title: Murray Koster
text:
Murray Koster (born 12 February 1999) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player from <a href="East%20London%2C%20Eastern%20Cape">East London, Eastern Cape</a>. He plays for the <a href="Sharks%20%28rugby%20union%29">Sharks</a> franchise as a <a href="centre%20%28rugby%20union%29">centre</a>.
Early life and career.
Koster was educated at <a href="St.%20Andrew%27s%20College%2C%20Grahamstown">St. Andrew's College, Grahamstown</a>, and played rugby for the school. For his performances during <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a>, he was called up to play for <a href="Eastern%20Province%20Elephants">Eastern Province Elephants</a> to play for their Country Districts team in 2017 but left them to join the Sharks youth system in 2018. In the same year, he played for the <a href="Sharks%20%28Currie%20Cup%29">Sharks' Currie Cup team</a> when they won the <a href="2018%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship">2018 Under-19 Provincial Championship</a> against the <a href="Blue%20Bulls">Blue Bulls</a>. In 2019, Koster played for the Sharks XV in the <a href="Rugby%20Challenge%20%28South%20Africa%29">Rugby Challenge</a>. Later in the year, he was invited to a <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa national under-20 rugby union team</a> selection camp for the Junior Springboks in the <a href="2019%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2019 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a>, however he was not selected. In 2020, he was added to the Sharks' <a href="2020%20Super%20Rugby%20season">Super Rugby</a> squad. However, a few months later, the season was cancelled due to the <a href="Impact%20of%20the%20COVID-19%20pandemic%20on%20sports%23Rugby%20union">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. The teams from South Africa instead played in the <a href="Super%20Rugby%20Unlocked">Super Rugby Unlocked</a> tournament over October and November.
In 2021, Koster made his professional rugby debut for the Sharks against the <a href="Griquas%20%28rugby%20union%29">Griquas</a> in the Preparation Series. However he missed the start of the <a href="Pro14%20Rainbow%20Cup">Pro14 Rainbow Cup</a> due to injury. On 10 July, he was selected to play for the Sharks in their second match against the touring <a href="British%20and%20Irish%20Lions">British and Irish Lions</a>, paired in the centre with <a href="Werner%20Kok">Werner Kok</a>. This followed the Lions having to rearrange <a href="2021%20British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">their tour</a> after their match against the <a href="Bulls%20%28rugby%20union%29">Bulls</a> was suspended following a COVID-19 outbreak in the Bulls team.
